item.title: Why should you withhold giving parenteral iron when there is an active infection?
item.description: In the UK, it is estimated that 3% of men and 8% of women have iron deficiency anaemia. Would giving parenteral iron add any clinical benefits to the patients now? What is the expected onset of action on the haemoglobin and iron levels? doi:10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2021.33935 doi: 10.1016/j.bbagen.2008.07.002

item.title: Repository-Clinical
item.description: 2021_Aug_Empagliflozin in Heart Failure with a Preserved Ejection Fraction Empagliflozin use in HFpEF. Study Name Author and Year Type of Study and Sample Size Treatment and Duration Study Endpoint and Primary Outcome Results Study 1 Author A (2020) Randomized Controlled Trial (n=100) Drug A, 6 months Endpoint X, Outcome Y Significant improvement in Y Study 2 Author B (2019) Cohort Study (n=200) Treatment B, 1 year Endpoint Z, Outcome W No significant change in W Study 3 Author C (2021) Case-Control Study (n=150) Intervention C, 3 months Endpoint Y, Outcome Z Outcome Z improved by 15% Study 4 Author D (2018) Cross-Sectional Study (n=250) Lifestyle change, 6 weeks Endpoint A, Outcome B Minor improvement in B Study 5 Author E (2022) Meta-Analysis (n=10 studies) Various, Duration varies Endpoint C, Outcome D Overall positive trend in D
